intro: Torilis leucotricha, commonly known as white-haired salsify, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a long, tubular fruit that is often used as a vegetable in some regions. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Torilis leucotricha is known for its edible roots and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
